body_text.text: S-2 Experimental Section DNA Construction. All oligonucleotide primers with proper restriction sites were ordered from Invitrogen. The p53dim gene was assembled by overlapping PCR. Synthesis of genes encoding SpyTag, SpyCatcher, and ELP were reported in our previous work. S1-3 The sequence of (GB1) 2 was directly ordered from Genscript Inc. All the genes were cloned into the bacterial expression vector pQE-80L (Qiagen Inc.) by standard restriction digestion and ligation protocols to get recombinant plasmids. Primers for cyclic and linear control mutants were prepared following QuickChange ® Site Directed Mutagenesis Protocol. The following primers were used for mutation to X': 5'-GTTTCGAAGAATTCCGTGAACCGAACGAAGCGCTGGAAC-3' 5'-GTTCCAGCGCTTCGTTCGGTTCACGGAATTCTTCGAAAC-3'.
The following primers were used for mutation to A': 5'-GCCCATATTGTCATGGTTGCTGCATACAAGCCGACGAAG-3' 5'-CTTCGTCGGCTTGTATGCAGCAACCATGACAATATGGGC-3'.
The sequences of the genes were verified by direct DNA sequencing.

Escherichia coli strain BL21 for expression. The starter culture was prepared by inoculating 10 mL of 2xYT medium containing 100 µg/mL of ampicillin with a single colony carrying the recombinant plasmid and allowing it to grow overnight at 37 °C in a shaker with the speed of 220 rpm. The overnight culture was used to inoculate 1 L of 2xYT medium containing 100 µg/mL of ampicillin and the culture was left to grow at 37 o C until OD 600 nm reached 0.7-1.0. Then, 1 mM of isopropyl β-D-1-thiogalactopyranoside (IPTG) was added to induce the protein expression and the cells were placed in the incubator for another 5 hour at 30 °C with 200 rpm shaking. Cells were pelleted by spinning at 5000g for 20 min at 4 °C. Cell pellets were lysed by ultrasonication under denaturing conditions (100 mM NaH 2 PO 4 , 10 mM Tris-HCl, 8 M urea, 10 mM imidazole, pH = 8.0). The protein was purified as described in the Qiagen Expressionist TM using 50% Ni-NTA slurry. The supernatant lysate was mixed with a 50% Ni-NTA slurry S-3 and agitated by the rotator at 4 o C for 1 hr. The mixture was then loaded into an empty column, washed with wash buffer (100 mM NaH 2 PO 4 , 10 mM Tris-HCl, 8 M urea, 20 mM imidazole, pH = 8.0) for several column volumes and then eluted by elution buffer (100 mM NaH 2 PO 4 , 10 mM 8 M urea, 20 mM imidazole, pH = 4.5). Proteins were then purified by SEC. The purified protein solution could be ) and a quadrupole rods SQ Detector 2 mass spectrometer (Waters Corp.). Separations were realized by a protein BEH C4 column (Waters 300 Å, 1.7 μm; 2.1 ×50 mm) using ultrapure water (with 0.1% formic acid) and acetonitrile as the mobile phase. For limited proteolysis experiments, digestion was performed with TEV protease at 4 o C for partial digestion and at 37 o C for full digestion, using PBS (pH = 7.4) as the working buffer. The mixture was analyzed by SDS-PAGE and also directly subjected to UPLC-ESIMS analysis.
body_text.section: Protein Expression and Purification. The recombinant plasmids were transformed into

body_text.text: The ESI-MS with TWIM separation was recorded with a Waters Synapt G2 mass spectrometer, using 0.7 mg sample in 1 mL of ACN/H 2 O (1:1, v/v) with 0.1% formic acid. The TWIM-MS experiments were performed under the following conditions: ESI capillary voltage, 3 kV; sample cone voltage, 30 V; extraction cone voltage, 3.5 V; source temperature 120 ºC; desolvation temperature, 150 ºC; cone gas S-4 flow, 10 L/h; desolvation gas flow, 700 L/h (N 2 ); source gas control, 0 mL/min; trap gas control, 2 mL/min; helium cell gas control, 100 mL/min; ion mobility (IM) cell gas control, 30 mL/min; sample flow rate, 5 µL/min; IM traveling wave height, 25 V; and IM traveling wave velocity, 1000 m/s. Trypsin Digestion. Trypsin powder (Amresco, USP grade) was dissolved in Tris-HCl (pH 8.0) to prepare a stock solution (10 mg/mL, 0.4 mM). Substrates in Tris-HCl (pH 8.0) were mixed with trypsin at a final protease: protein ratio of 1:20 (w/w). Trypsin digestion experiments were performed by incubation at 25 o C for extended time course. After designated times, aliquots were taken and digestion was quenched by adding 5x loading buffer followed by boiling at 100 o C for 10 min. All samples were analyzed by SDS-PAGE and further quantified by gel densitometry on Typhoon FLA9500 (GE Healthcare, Inc. In pathway (a), premature cyclization before dimerization gives the cyclic monomer. In pathway (b), the dimerization of X motif entwines the two chains. Depending on the geometry and the linker length/flexibility, four products are then possible, namely (from left to right) the interlocked [2]catenane, the simple cyclic dimer, the knotted cyclic dimer, and the noncovalently associated rings.

body_text.text: Figure S17. Possible sites for trypsin digestion of EAXBE. Due to high similarity in sequence, the distribution of trypsin digestions sites are almost the same in EAX'BE and EA'X'BE.

Figure S18. Possible sites for trypsin digestion of EBXAE. Due to high similarity in sequence, the distribution of trypsin digestions sites are almost the same in EBX'AE and EB'X'AE. Figure S19 . Trypsin digestion profile of (A) EAXBE, (B) EAX'BE, (C) EA'X'BE. The digestion of cyclic monomer produces a relinearized monomer whose position is very close to the cyclic precursor. Since their bands are both smeared, the extent of digestion could not be accurately quantified for comparison. Figure S20 . Trypsin digestion profile of (A) EBXAE, (B) EBX'AE, and (C) EBX'A'E. The digestion of cyclic monomer produces a relinearized monomer whose position is very close to the cyclic precursor. Since their bands are both smeared, the extent of digestion could not be accurately quantified for comparison.

BIBREF1.title: Synthesis of bioactive protein hydrogels by genetically encoded SpyTag-SpyCatcher chemistry

BIBREF2.title: Controlling macromolecular topology with genetically encoded SpyTag-SpyCatcher chemistry

FIGREF0.text: desalted using PD10 column (GE Healthcare, Inc.). The protein yields were approximately 25-45 mg/L. Protein Characterization. Sodium dodecyl sulfate polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis (SDS-PAGE) was performed to determine the apparent molecular weight of each protein. Size exclusion chromatography (SEC) was performed on a Superdex 200 increase 10/300 GL column with ÄKTA FPLC system (GE Healthcare Inc.). PBS (pH = 7.4) was used as the mobile phase at a flow rate of 0.5 mL/min. Matrix-assisted laser desorption ionization time-of-flight mass spectrometry (MALDI-TOF MS) was conducted on a MALDI TOF/TOF 5800 (AB Sciex, USA) mass spectrometer with sinapinic acid as the matrix. Protein quantification could be performed on a nanodrop (IMPLEN P330) for samples purified by SEC. Gel densitometry analysis was performed on Typhoon FLA9500 (GE Healthcare, Inc.) for SDS-PAGE images. Ultra-performance liquid chromatography-electrospray ionization mass spectrometry (UPLC-ESIMS) analyses were performed on a system equipped with an ACQUITY H-Class UPLC (Waters Corp.

UPLC-ESI mass spectra of (A) AXB, (B) partially digested AXB, and (C) completely digested AXB. The asterisk represents an unidentified species with molecular weight of 47135.
